reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A psychological thriller that drops breadcrumbs of clues
reviews.reviewText: The story revolves around two young women, Nicole and Megan, who go missing under mysterious circumstances. The novel unfolds through a dual timeline, alternating between the present-day investigation led by forensic pathologist Livia, Nicole's sister, and the past, revealing the events leading up to the girls' disappearance.Livia is a compelling protagonist, driven by her determination to uncover the truth about her sister's disappearance. The book expertly navigates the emotional toll that such a traumatic event takes on the characters, making them relatable and human.The plot is intricately layered, with numerous twists and turns that keep the reader guessing until the very end. Another great read by Charlie Donlea

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Was it a book or a movie?
reviews.reviewText: At first, I didn't know what to think of the back and forth with past and present. It only made sense after finishing the book. Even with my confusion of why that was, I was captivated.This book sucks you in. I couldn't put it down. It will take you to places you can visualize; like you are there in the moments.Keep reading. It is not who you think.This is a book that when you think about it in the future, you will forget whether you read it or watched it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Will bring you in on the first page
reviews.reviewText: I was not able to put the book down once I started. This book goes into so much detail. I would definitely recommend if you like a murder mystery. It’s sooooo good

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best mystery i have ever read!
reviews.reviewText: I could hardly put this book down. The story was always evoling and never boring. There was a lot of suspense and the ending was the same. It left me wanting more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really thought I had it figured out halfway through but I was wrong. I loved the twist but the ending left me a little mad.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book may have actually been a four star read. It could possibly have been a five.The writing was good and the story was even better.But we’re all familiar with the old fable in which a kingdom is lost for the want of a horseshoe nail, right? The same concept applies to a book filled with small errors, throughout.“She diverted her eyes from his…”“She released the break and the car rolled…”“Livia politely rebuked his offer…”“It was a genuine startle, where nearly every bone in his body jerked…”Being a grammar Nazi isn’t my bag, but misspellings and awkward descriptive words are jarring to the reader. The entire flow of the story grounds to a halt because we are forced to back up and reread the passage, (losing momentum and interest) attempting to correct these errors mentally.Is “book editor” even a thing anymore? Even the major publishing houses are printing books that are an embarrassment to this country in terms of grammar and sentence construct.I hate when a really good book, such as this one, is relegated to one or two stars, because the author was cheated of a decent book editor by their agent and their publishing house. You are better off hiring an English major at a nearby college to help with your manuscript, than allowing your work to be published by a company who doesn’t employ a good book and story editor.Either that, or spend the rest of your writing days on Kindle Unlimited.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars creative plot/ thrilling mystery/ twists!!
reviews.reviewText: This plot is so creative and captivating! I really thought I figured it out 3 times and boy was I wrong. The cliffhanger ending has me so angry because it’s so well done! If you like mysteries and thrillers you have to read this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Gave as a gift and itWas enjoyed by the reader the book had larger print which was good The book was in good condition and was sent in a timely fashion
A page turning thriller not for the faint of heart. If you like true crime podcasts, the novel is like one in book form.

Do mesmo autor, Charlie Donlea, do conclamado Summit Lake, achei este segundo livro bem melhor do primeiro. Um verdadeiro thriller. Os muitos flah-backs ajudam a compreensão e a relação invertida entre e a morte e a vida, isto é, como a morte pode ser a luz para encontrar a vida é o aspecto mais profundo do livro que deixa o leitor com a respiração suspensa até a ultima pagina.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on January 6, 2021
reviews.reviewText: that kind of book that is impossible to stop reading
A chilling book I couldn't put down. I thought I had worked out the ending but was completely wrong. I enjoyed 'Summit Lake', Charlie Donlea's first novel, every bit as much.

The plot and character development was excellent. In addition, the author must have performed research on forensic and medical examination, with interesting descriptions of autopsies and the routines ‘fellows’examiners have it go through. The clues left pointed to several persons, leaving the reader guessing as to who the killer was until near the end. However, there were some typos and errors, e.g. the word “implement” was used when the correct word should be “ implicate”. Sometimes too, the sentences used were somewhat cumbersome. I have the feeling that the story was written in a hurry, especially the end. I would give this a four and a half star if I could.
